metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2805 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Parser). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.44 and prior,5.7.26 and prior and 8.0.16 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.3.17-1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-client - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-client-10.3 - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-client-core-10.3 - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-common - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-server - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-server-10.3 - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-server-core-10.3 - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-test - 1:10.3.17-1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.3.17-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.3.17-1').
